pitch_story: Your 18-tonner fits with room to spare. Wide tree-lined avenue, flat approach, plenty of turning space at the end.
Classic removal nightmare. Terraced street, parked cars both sides. Luton van fits, but the 18-tonner physically cannot. You'd need to shuttle — now you can price that into the quote.
6% gradient on the approach. Your loaded 18-tonner is going to work hard, especially in the wet. Tool flags it as AMBER so the driver knows to plan for it.
Good width, flat approach. But it's a cul-de-sac — the 18-tonner can get in but there's barely enough room to turn around at the end. The 7.5-tonner turns fine.
Built for trucks. Wide commercial road, no restrictions, turning circles designed for HGVs. Send whatever you need.

scenario: Worst case: narrow + steep + dead end
pitch_story: The trifecta of pain. Narrow Victorian streets, 8% gradient, dead end with no turning. Send the Luton van. Plan for 3 trips. Here's what that costs.
